name: Beet Wellington
description: Gordon Ramsay's version of the classic steak dish – a showstopping centrepiece on a special occasions
directions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Roast the beet with olive oil, salt, and pepper for 45 minutes.
Wrap the beet in puff pastry and brush with beaten egg.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.

name: Napa Cabbage Kimchi
description: this dish is so common and iconic among Koreans that we simply call it “kimchi.” When people talk about kimchi, this is the side dish they’re referring to, despite the fact that there are many kinds of kimchi in Korean cuisine, and many made with napa cabbage, too.
directions: Cut the napa cabbage into quarters and salt each layer.
Let the cabbage sit for 2 hours, then rinse and drain.
Mix the remaining ingredients to make the kimchi paste.
Spread the paste on each leaf of the cabbage.
Pack the cabbage into a jar and let it ferment for at least 3 days.

name: Old-Fashion Potato Salad
description: This potato salad recipe is for the traditional creamy type of potato salad, with eggs, celery, and relish. It's perfect for making ahead to let the flavors develop.
directions: Boil the potatoes until tender, then peel and chop.
Mix the potatoes with the chopped eggs, celery, and relish.
Stir in the mayonnaise and season with salt and pepper.
Chill the potato salad for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Churros
description: This churros recipe is astonishingly easy, and makes a truly great churros that’s hot and crisp on the outside, fluffy on the inside.
directions: In a saucepan, bring water, sugar, salt, and butter to a boil.
Remove from heat and stir in flour until the mixture forms a ball.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375°F (190°C).
Pipe the dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and roll in sugar and cinnamon.

name: Melted Cheese Ramyun
description: Popular in Korea, melted cheese ramyun is an easy way to cut through the intense spice of Shin Ramyun and adds a delicious creamy flavour!
directions: Boil water in a pot and add the Shin Ramyun noodles and seasoning.
Cook for 4 minutes, then add the slice of American cheese.
Stir until the cheese is melted and serve hot.
